Description: Mould-made pottery lamp decorated on the discus with a goat-herd with three goats, and a dog asleep at the base of a tree. On each side of the shoulder is a lug-handle. At the rear is a ring handle. The lamp stands on a raised base with three pelta-shaped feet. Brown clay, very micaceous; traces of a red slip remain over a light-coloured slip. The nozzle and handle are broken.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1916)
Barone 1984 / Alessandria e il Mondo Ellenistico-Romano (p.297)
